title: Ask HN: How do you do financial planning?
text:
Do you outsource your financial planning or do you prefer to do it yourself? Is there an AI that can outperform a human financial planner?

My goal is to automate the process of making financial decisions based on user profiles, including age, conservativeness, estimated retirement age, and estimated retirement funds.

The whole problem of {user profile, context, set of possible actions} -> {action} seems doable to me.

For example, if I am confronted with a new concept like an RRSP (US eq of 401K) loan, I would like an app that can calculate whether it's worth taking the loan based on the potential profit and tax benefits. Or I have a line of credit offer. Can I make profit from it?

Ask HN: How has Notion changed your life?
text:
Wondering what all the hype is about. Looking for some anecdotal data regarding your experience with Notion and why you can never go back to life without it.

I don't work at Notion nor am I affiliated with them, just trying to understand the burning need that it has addressed for you to help me decide if I should invest in integrating it into my life.

Thanks!!
